abstract: City Council holds hearing to review New York City Police Dept's undercover efforts since the Sept 11 terrorist attacks; several council members raise the possibility of requiring an outside review when police intend to conduct undercover surveillance as part of counterterrorism investigations to ensure that Muslims are not being unfairly targeted; Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly says the force is simply following leads and not engaging in racial profiling.
snippet: Most of the questioning of Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly was about the breadth of the New York Police Department’s undercover efforts since the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: Most of the questioning of Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly was about the breadth of the New York Police Department’s undercover efforts since the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.

headline.main: City Council Grills Kelly on Police Surveillance of Muslims
